de.esoco.lib.io

Class StreamUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.io.StreamUtil

  • public final class StreamUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Class containing tools for access to IO streams.

      • find

        public static boolean find(java.io.InputStream rIn,
                           byte[] rToken,
                           int nMax,
                           StreamUtil.ReadHandler rHandler)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Seeks to the position after the next occurrence of a certain token in an input stream. This method does no extra buffering, so if necessary a buffered stream should be used for optimal performance. If this method returns TRUE the token had been found in the stream and the stream will be positioned directly behind the last byte in the token.

        If the handler argument is not NULL, this instance of the inner class ByteHandler will be invoked for each byte that is read from the stream (including the search token).

        Parameters:
        rIn - The input stream to read from
        rToken - The token to search for; tokens of type byte[] are used directly
        nMax - The maximum number of bytes to read
        rHandler - A handler to be invoked for values read or NULL for none
        Returns:
        TRUE if the token has been found, FALSE if the end of the stream has been reached
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If reading from the stream fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the search token is empty

      • find

        public static boolean find(java.io.Reader rInput,
                           java.lang.String sToken,
                           int nMax,
                           boolean bIgnoreCase,
                           StreamUtil.ReadHandler rHandler)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Searches a character input stream for a certain token. If this method returns TRUE the input stream reader will be positioned directly after the found token.
        Parameters:
        rInput - The input stream reader to read from
        sToken - The token to search
        nMax - The maximum number of characters that should be read
        bIgnoreCase - TRUE if the case of the token should be ignored
        rHandler - A handler to be invoked for values read or NULL for none
        Returns:
        TRUE if the token has been found, FALSE if not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If accessing the stream fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the search token is empty

      • readAll

        public static byte[] readAll(java.io.InputStream rIn,
                             int nBufferSize,
                             int nMax)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Reads all bytes from an input stream and returns a byte array containing the data. The buffer size argument should be either the exact size that will be read or a reasonable fraction of the expected size to prevent unnecessary buffer allocations.
        Parameters:
        rIn - The input stream to read from
        nBufferSize - The initial buffer size
        nMax - The maximum number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the bytes read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case of IO errors
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the buffer size is invalid

      • readAll

        public static java.lang.String readAll(java.io.Reader rIn,
                                       int nBufferSize,
                                       int nMax)
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Reads all bytes from a Reader and returns a string containing the character data. The buffer size argument should be either the exact size that will be read or a reasonable fraction of the expected size to prevent unnecessary buffer allocations.
        Parameters:
        rIn - The reader to read from
        nBufferSize - The initial buffer size
        nMax - The maximum number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the bytes read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case of IO errors
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the buffer size is invalid

      • readUntil

        public static boolean readUntil(java.io.InputStream rIn,
                                java.io.OutputStream rOut,
                                byte[] rToken,
                                int nMax)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all bytes from a stream until the next occurrence of a certain token and and returns a boolean that indicates whether the token has been found. The data will be read into the output stream argument. If the token is found the output will end at it's last byte. Otherwise it contains all data that had been read until the maximum number of bytes had been reached.

        Invokes find(InputStream, byte[], int, ReadHandler) to perform the actual search.

        Parameters:
        rIn - The input stream to read from
        rOut - The output stream to write data to
        rToken - The token to read up to
        nMax - The maximum number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the bytes read from the stream up to the search token or NULL if the token couldn't be found.
        Throws:
        java.io.EOFException - If the stream ends before the string token could be found
        java.io.IOException - If reading from the stream fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the search string is empty
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If writing to the output stream fails (wraps the IO exception that occurred)

      • readUntil

        public static boolean readUntil(java.io.Reader rIn,
                                java.io.Writer rOut,
                                java.lang.String sToken,
                                int nMax,
                                boolean bIgnoreCase)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a string from a character stream until the next occurrence of a certain token and returns a boolean that indicates whether the token has been found. The data will be read into the output writer argument. If the token is found the output will end at it's last character. Otherwise it contains all data that had been read until the maximum number of characters had been reached.

        Invokes find(Reader, String, int, boolean, ReadHandler) to perform the actual search.

        Parameters:
        rIn - The reader to read the data from
        rOut - A writer to write the characters that have been to
        sToken - The token to read up to
        nMax - The maximum number of characters to read
        bIgnoreCase - TRUE if the case of the token should be ignored
        Returns:
        The string read from the stream up to but excluding the search token or NULL if the token couldn't be found
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If reading from the stream fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the search string is empty
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If either argument is NULL
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If writing to the output stream fails (wraps the IO exception that occurred)

      • saveStream

        public static void saveStream(java.io.InputStream rStream,
                              java.lang.String sOutputFile,
                              int nMax)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads bytes from an input stream and saves them into a file.
        Parameters:
        rStream - The input stream to read data from
        sOutputFile - The name of the file to write the data into
        nMax - The maximum number of bytes to read from the stream; if the stream contains less bytes only these will be written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If accessing the stream or the file fails

      • send

        public static long send(java.io.InputStream rInput,
                        java.io.OutputStream rOutput)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the data from an input stream to an output stream. This method uses a buffer of 8K for the transfer so it is not necessary to wrap the streams in buffered streams.
        Parameters:
        rInput - The input stream to read the data to send from
        rOutput - The target output stream
        Returns:
        The number of bytes sent
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a stream access fails

      • send

        public static long send(java.io.Reader rInput,
                        java.io.Writer rOutput)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the data from a reader to a writer. This method uses a buffer of 8K for the transfer so it is not necessary to wrap the streams in buffered streams.
        Parameters:
        rInput - The reader to read the data to send from
        rOutput - The target writer
        Returns:
        The number of characters sent
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a stream access fails
